name: Plickers
headline: Data without devices
description: Plickers lets you poll your class for free, without the need for student devices. Just give each student a card (a "paper clicker"), and use your smartphone to scan them to do instant checks-for-understanding, exit tickets, and impromptu polls. Best of all, your data is automatically saved, student-by-student, at plickers.com.

My favourite tech resource is Plickers! I use Plickers daily during math. My students can self assess, exit questions do surveys or answer questions.
[![Profile Picture for teachmomrepeat](https://res.cloudinary.com/plickers-static/image/upload/c_fill,h_32,w_32/staticassets/1187527866382204931_profile.jpg)Carly Black@teachmomrepeat](http://www.plickers.com/<https:/twitter.com/teachmomrepeat/status/1187527866382204931>)
I love that I can quickly see who needs help and who's ready to move on. Kids can ask for help without the whole room knowing.

Total Participation using Plickers cards for multiple choice problems. So simple, just point your phone at the card from anywhere in the room and you have a quick check point.

Love using **@plickers** as a quick check for understanding! It's awesome feedback - instantly shows me who needs more practice and who's ready to move on! **#proud2bFSES**

Pride and Prejudice & Plickers in the classroom is a hit with my freshies! **@CaptGrizzly**

[![Profile Picture for wendyhilburn](https://res.cloudinary.com/plickers-static/image/upload/c_fill,h_32,w_32/staticassets/1187401136250216448_profile.jpg)WHilburn@wendyhilburn](http://www.plickers.com/<https:/twitter.com/wendyhilburn/status/1187401136250216448>)

The kids love Plickers because it feels like a game. I love **#plickers** because I get instant feedback on their progress and can use it to form small groups and differentiate instructions. **#winwin**
![Tweet Image MsGonzalesGTSci's Tweet](https://res.cloudinary.com/plickers-static/image/upload/w_320/staticassets/1196871957469421569_image.jpg)
[![Profile Picture for MsOlson](https://res.cloudinary.com/plickers-static/image/upload/c_fill,h_32,w_32/staticassets/1195015548918226944_profile.jpg) Maranda Olson@MsOlson](http://www.plickers.com/<https:/twitter.com/MsOlson/status/1195015548918226944>)
I loveeee using **#plickers** to assess where my kids are at and what we need to work on. Immediate data!
[![Profile Picture for laulreb](https://res.cloudinary.com/plickers-static/image/upload/c_fill,h_32,w_32/staticassets/1180216072978481152_profile.jpg)Laura@laulreb](http://www.plickers.com/<https:/twitter.com/laulreb/status/1180216072978481152>)
Quick easy assessment & get the breakdown instantly on my end! Loving our plickers cards!
[![Profile Picture for mssamhunter](https://res.cloudinary.com/plickers-static/image/upload/c_fill,h_32,w_32/staticassets/1189747722552778753_profile.jpg)Samantha Hunter@mssamhunter](http://www.plickers.com/<https:/twitter.com/mssamhunter/status/1189747722552778753>)
To quote the students in Room 27.... "When can we do that game again?" **@plickers** is definitely one of their favourite types of assessment.

generated_description:
Plickers is a game-changer in classroom assessment, embodying the mantra “Data without devices.” Founded in 2011 and part of Y Combinator's Batch IK12, Plickers aims to simplify formative assessments for teachers and their students. The company, based in San Francisco, operates with a nimble team of just five employees, under the guidance of Group Partner Nan.

So, what exactly is Plickers? At its core, it's an innovative tool that allows teachers to conduct real-time polls without requiring each student to have a device. Instead, each student gets a unique QR code card. The teacher scans these cards with their smartphone to gather responses for checks-for-understanding, exit tickets, and quick polls—all without the distractions of classroom tech. The beauty of Plickers lies in its data collection; responses are saved automatically on Plickers.com, providing detailed insights on student performance, lesson effectiveness, and engagement.

What’s more, Plickers has gained traction worldwide, being utilized by K-12 educators in over 100 countries. Teachers love it; they rave about its ability to inject fun into lessons and provide instant feedback. Social media is dotted with testimonials from educators who say their students enjoy the interactive elements, describing it as playing a game while assessing knowledge.

If you're an educator looking for a fresh, engaging teaching tool, Plickers is worth checking out. You can sign up for free at [Plickers.com](http://www.plickers.com) and join the growing community of educators making assessments more intuitive and enjoyable.
